```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(purrr)
```

```{r}

#
possible_flubber = data.frame(color = c("Pink", "Blue", "Green"), mass = c(30, 15, 43), viscosity = c(150, 1500, 4000))

```

```{r for loop}

possible_flubber

# assume a log normal distribution of rotation speeds with mean 2.5 m/s
# sample size = 200

nsample = 200
mean_speed = 2.5

rotation = rlnorm(mean=mean_speed, sd=0.125*mean_speed, nsample)

# use for loop to cycle through all rotation speeds
# create a data frame to store for loop results: one column for each car and one row for each speed

flub_power1 = as.data.frame(matrix(nrow=length(rotation),
                            ncol=nrow(possible_flubber)))

# because we don't initialize it - values are NA
head(flub_power1)

# source flubber_power function
source("../R/flubber_power.R")


# index in to a matrix
for (i in 1:nrow(possible_flubber)) {
  flub_power1[,i] = flubber_power(mass=possible_flubber$mass[i], 
                                  viscosity = possible_flubber$viscosity[i],
                                  rotation=rotation)
}

colnames(flub_power1)=flub_power1$color
head(flub_power1)
```
